member.summary: Base class for all Data Connectors and Plugins.

member.name: P:DarkRift.Server.ExtendedPluginBase.ThreadSafe
member.summary: Is this plugin able to handle multithreaded events?
member.remarks: Enabling this option allows DarkRift to send messages to your plugin from multiple threads simultaneously, greatly increasing performance. Do not enable this unless you are confident that you understand multithreading else you will find yourself with a variety of unfriendly problems to fix!

member.name: P:DarkRift.Server.ExtendedPluginBase.Commands
member.summary: The commands the plugin has.
member.remarks: This is an array of commands that can be executed by this plugin and will be searched through when the command is executed. Changes to this array will be reflected instantly by the command system.

The resource directory can be used to store any external resources your plugin requires such as web files etc. It will be removed when uninstalling your plugin so you should not store any files elsewhere.
This location may not exist if called from the constructor, use the event instead.

member.summary: The component that sent the message.

member.summary: The message that was sent.

member.summary: The type of log that was sent.

member.summary: The exception (if present) that caused the event.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Server.WriteEventArgs.FormattedMessage
member.summary: A formatted version of the event.
member.remarks: For efficiency you should log this whereever possible rather than re build your own formatted string for the message as this will be precomputed once for all log writers and it well optimized. It is also more consistent to those reading logs if tey are all the same format.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Server.WriteEventArgs.LogTime

The log level of the message logged.

A forrmatted string of the message details.
The time the message was logged.
